intro: Albuca albucoides, commonly known as the white bulbous lily, is a perennial flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asparagaceae family and is characterized by its swollen, white underground bulbs. The plant produces upright stems with narrow, grass-like leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade. Albuca albucoides is often cultivated for its ornamental value and easy care requirements.
